comments.value:
Hello

We have a fairly urgent brief for a new functionality for online ticketing security. 

I have put together a brief but am happy to discuss.

The main thing I need from you right now is a sense of cost and timescale, plus how you would implement.

Thank you!!

Morag

Marked as high. We will take a look and get back to you ASAP.

Quick question: how long is the list of Authorised Ticket Resellers likely to be?

I think it will be c. 200 but each may have multiple domains, which is the tricky thing.

Thanks for looking at it - we def need to get a move on with it!
Date provisionally reset to Feb 10. This one should be treated as very high up the priority list and we need to confirm that we can deliver for then.

Hello

Are you able to get back to me with a cost / time estimate / approach for this piece of work? We need to start on it pretty soon....
We were discussing this yesterday and we will get back to you shortly. Marking as urgent for now.

Morag,

Please find attached a PDF with time/cost estimate, please do feel free to call me to discuss this to make sure we are clear on what your expecting us to deliver by when, esp. given the timescales.

thanks

Jamie
Change to timeline on this. We want this to be live 21 Feb - which gives us an extra week to develop.

Morag,

Can you remind we what changes / additions you wanted to add to the spec?

We talked about different messages per valid url ie. "this site is valid for Spanish ticket purchases" and something else?


Woudl this do as a valid site file?

Not to make it more complex and obviously time is short so the spec need to be kept tight, but:

- would you need more than one valid url per supplier? ie. www.ticketmaster.es *and* london2012.ticketmaster.es
- would you need links in the info text? as we'd need to be careful that that didn't break the xml or cause output issues.

<validSites>
    <site>
         <title>Ticketmaster Espana</url>
         <url>www.ticketmaster.es</url>
         <info>Ticketmaster Espana is the official Spanish ticket agent of London 2012.</info>
    <site>
    <site>
         <title>Prestige Ticketing</url>
         <url>prestigeticketing.london2012.com</url>
         <info>The official on-site hospitality provider for the London 2012 Games. Please note that prestige ticketing only offer hospitality packages and not individual tickets.</info>
    <site>
</validSites>
Note to all: I am quite keen to have these requirements pinned down by Monday if at all possible.
Coming up

Hello

Just to refine the spec on the basis of discussions in the past week:

The main tweak is that we would now like to be able to give a specific result back based on a correct search. i.e. If you input a valid URL e.g. ticketmaster.es you would get a message along the lines of 'This is the authorised ticketing website for Spain and Portugal'. If you input an invalid URL you would only get a generic message e.g. 'This is not recognised as an official London 2012 tickets website'. We would supply an extra field in the spreadsheet, with a description of what the specific website relates to.

Field validation: Jag is concerned that having a field into which people can paste URLs is a potential avenue for malicious code injection. Can you advise what checks would be done to prevent people from entering malicious code, or any other security measures you can take? Jag is likely to get this pen tested pre go-live, so I'm keen to shortcircuit any possible objections near to launch. Or do I flip it back to Jag and ask him what he requires?

Testing: for the pen testing to be carried out, I think we would need staging to be available. I'm not clear whether it will be ready in time for end of Feb though. Jag is now also concerned that if we market the tool to the public (which we will) there is a risk of heavy traffic hitting the data centres. He is keen to involve BT/Akamai in this - not something you need to worry about just now, but just flagging as another reason to leave ourselves plenty of time to test...

Timing change: we are now aiming for completion and population by 21 February to handover to ITS for their tests, allowing us to go live on 28 February. 

Additional information:
We think there will be c. 500 URLs initially

In answer to your question, yes, there almost certainly would be more than one valid url per supplier, as some ATRs will have multiple domains and use ticket agencies. I am assuming we can simply enter multiple rows with the same agency but different domains?

Links in the info text: the only link we would want I think is the ability in the generic 'Not valid' response to be able to say 'View a full list of authorised ticket resellers' and link through to Ticketmaster. It would be the same message and the same web link in all cases where the URL wasn't valid. I don't think we require to add links to the valid sites - since the user already has the URL, that assumes they are on the site or have been on it.

Reporting on URLs - we would ideally like a weekly spreadsheet report emailed to my colleagues in Brand Protection weekly, plus also the ability to login on an ad hoc basis to download the report. The report would detail the URL plus a time/date stamp for when it was entered. 

Badges - we can drop this element of the brief altogether, on the basis that the ATRs will be provided with some assets by our Brand team, and because it is impossible to create something which is not rip-offable. 

Top Fake sites - this will be a content editable area on the page, where we can update the list  manually. I'm not sure how it will live on the page in relation to the Website checker - they should be close to each other, and ideally stand out clearly. Do you think we require some design work here? I was thinking that a graphic in 2012 font saying 'Fake ticket sites' and 'Tickets website checker' would be enough.

In terms of adding / uploading new official sites, I will have a spreadsheet tomorrow of the known authorised domains to date. Hopefully that spreadsheet could be uploaded automatically? We would also need an interface to be able to add additional URLs and their status manually subsequently, both pre and post launch.

Just scanned back through your brief and wanted to clarify a couple of additional things:

Editing the list - I think editing an xml file is probably okay, although it does then place the onus on me and my team to edit and upload records. If there is any way of making a simple interface, that would make the tool easier for other people to manage, and would be preferable, if time permits!

Javascript based look up box - this sounds like it might be the best option from a user perspective, so am happy to go with this if time allows. Does this present any accessibilty issues?

1.3a Tracking of fake domains entered by users - ideally we would have the ability to export but also even better to automatically email these domains in xls format to specified email addresses in our Brand Protection team.

Jamie, suggested amendments to brief:

- Add 1/2 day liaison with ITS, to answer questions about forms and so forth.

- you say "If a more editorial friendly approach is required please let us know." Morag has asked, so we need to give her an estimate.

- "Reporting on URLs - we would ideally like a weekly spreadsheet report emailed to my colleagues in Brand Protection weekly, plus also the ability to login on an ad hoc basis to download the report. The report would detail the URL plus a time/date stamp for when it was entered.... 1.3a Tracking of fake domains entered by users - ideally we would have the ability to export but also even better to automatically email these domains in xls format to specified email addresses in our Brand Protection team." This looks more ambitions than your "A export of all fake domains from the CMS in a CSV or Excel format" We need to re-estimate this.

- Also, "1.3a Tracking of fake domains entered by users - ideally we would have the ability to export but also even better to automatically email these domains in xls format to specified email addresses in our Brand Protection team."

- "1.2b Website lookup box / tool (Javascript based) [-OPTIONAL-]" is no longer optional. They want it.

- "Top Fake sites - this will be a content editable area on the page, where we can update the list manually. I'm not sure how it will live on the page in relation to the Website checker - they should be close to each other, and ideally stand out clearly. Do you think we require some design work here? " A response on this one.

One additional comment - on the negative sites i.e. where a URL turns out to be not official, we want to return a message with several links in it, not just one. See the attached grab from the GHD site for illustration where you get referred to genuine sites. We wouldn't want that many links, but we would want to be able to say e.g. 

'This is not an official London 2012 website. 

If you live in the UK or a designed European country, you can buy tickets from the official London 2012 website [link]. You can buy hospitality packages from the Prestige Ticketing website. [ link]

If you do not live in a designated European country, view a list of Authorised Ticket resellers [link] to find the appropriate channel to purchase tickets.'

Hope that is okay!

Morag,

Quick question,

Given then number of valid providers, would you prefer a single XML file (you can edit offline) or would you prefer we built a little interface a bit like events / suppliers where you can enter/edit each one individually.

The downside to the interface is you'd need to enter each valid supplier separately and couldn't send round the XML file for viewing, editing / reloading.

The upside to the interface is it would be easy to add a new entry / supplier or edit an existing one (via the CMS) we can make sure that links etc. work properly / that  formatting doesn't break the XML.

The ideal would obviously would be to store them all separately in the CMS and then import a large Excel sheet of them all at the start (what you want us to do with the event sessions) but this isn't without it's own issues,  it may take time to get the import working correctly (it normally does) and you would only be able to enter that sheet sheet once, subsequent updates would need to be make the the CMS.

Actually given the original format won't be XML I'm half answering my own question, the XML file isn't going to be a massive time saver to you over holding a record for each in the CMS.

If possible I'd like the decision to be taken imagining you won't have the Excel import (as we may have issues there, esp. with importing muli-line content).

I think I'm leaning towards a separate record for each in the CMS with a little interface to enter them (and a quick stab, but no guarantee, to see if we can get an TSV / Excel import working; but lets imagine we can't do this for the purpose of the decision). But shout if you'd prefer editing one large XML file.

Work wise (Excel import aside) there's not going to be much between them as parts of on are harder and other parts easier for us with both routes.

Hello

Sorry for delay in responding – your quick questions always end up taking days for me to answer. V bad ☹

Like you I agree that the better option is a separate record for each in the CMS with a little interface to enter / edit them. NB with this option we’d need to be able easily to find a record out of the 600 if we need to make a tweak – how would we do this?

If we can also get an TSV / Excel import working that would be perfect.

Thank you!

Morag

Hi Andy/Liz/Morag,

The ticket checker is sitting here ready to test:
http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/test/website-checker.php

- Valid agents are here (this is via an Excel import and should be valid) you can also add extra domains to a ticket agent here.
   http://dev.kitsite.com/kit/data/ticketagents

-  Sites which the frontend does not recognize are stored here in the CMS:
   http://dev.kitsite.com/kit/data/unrecognizedticketagents

- We also have a email export of the above that can run daily, weekly, monthly (who do we send it to?)

- On the ticket page you need to confirm the correct text for both the valid and invalid retainers, the text we have is pretty much confirmed / on spec with what I discussed with Morag. So be aware any radical deviations may cause delays or issues!!

- The valid message is auto generated like so {vendor} is an official retailer for {list of countries} 

- If the vendor has something entered in the 'extra information' field it can override (or be shown in addition) to the above text, although that 'extra info' text is only plain text (ie. can't contain links). It was there so you could say "Foo tickets is a corporate ticket partner".

- Link for official ticket page

- "We didn't recognize this retailer. Details »" (the thought was here was you might want a page where it explained that if they sport an error and they think they have a valid retailer that is showing as invalid what they can do; or even just more info on valid retailers)

- Do you want any promos in the right hand side?

- What goes under the checker? there was talk of putting a list of Invalid sites here (we even mocked up some HTML, will turn it back on so you can see it, it was basically a two col list on a redish background) but wanted to confirm you did want that on this page as the consensus here was that that might be confusing (ie. a list of valid agents would seem sensible, but invalid ones? is there not is a danger of people misunderstanding why you have listed dodgy2012ticksts.com on your website / ticket check page?)

- Image at the top, can you get a image commissioned for this? If not we may be better off using a simpler template, but that's not a quick change (might take us a couple of hours to swap them over and check everything still works).

I think Morag will pick most of this up, but can I chip in and say we definitely DON’T want a list of invalid site URLs. We are an authoritative domain for all things Olympic, so having these here would actually improve their search rankings. (We could of course use ‘nofollow’, but I also think even having the links would be confusing.)

Cheers,
Andy
Thats what I thought !!
Btw I think the idea was text not links but still !!

Thanks so much, Jamie!

I am looking at these links now and will get back to you with my thoughts asap.

Welcome back :)

Hope you had a great time

Oh, and - regarding launching it - what would like the path to be and ... when would you like it launched?
Kieran
Yes, that should be fine
Are you able to give me a quick ring to talk about this?

Feedback re: Opera bugs:

“Follow-up it looks like, it is an issue with staging server in Opera, when I try to access vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com on staging server then it does not get render properly, opera is not loading CSS, JavaScript and Images from the staging server, but live london2012.com is rendering perfectly fine there is no issue from main site.”

Does this make sense?

Hi Morag, A few things:

1. I've replicated the problem with Opera but ... as your report suggests, it does just seem restricted to the staging server. I don't know why this should be! It might be because of the password-protection. Opera is refusing to load css/js out of security concerns but I don't know it well enough to be able to work out why... Luckily, it all looks fine on the live site - which brings me on to...
2. I've amended the text, as per your requests.
3. I've moved the page to about-this-website. It now appears here:
  http://www.london2012.com/about-this-website/ticketing-website-checker.php


Kieran

Perfect – thank you!

One more question – how long should it take new records to be updated in the tool? I am adding in subdomains e.g. getset.london2012.com but they are not giving me positive results.

The ticketing page needs to be republished in order to pick up changes.
although we can make this happen automatically if you would rather...
Launched 1am, Mar 15.

Duncan and I were just running through with Uzma the templates/pages that we need to send to Russ@ITS tomorrow morning for testing and came across a few issues. We really need to solve these before handing over to ITS so they test the finished template, or as close to it. Can you look at these this evening so we’re ready to go tomorrow am?
 
Greenwich page (template V)
·         Can the image size for the ‘Travel to Greenwich’ promo be the same size as the images on the Map (M) template? Just saves Uzma cropping the same image to two different sizes.
·         In the local attraction promo, only the first link has an external window icon – whereas all three should.
 
The UK venues promo
Can we edit the image/link and header, as on many of the pages we’ll need one or the other? This will also allow us to update the UK image in house, which we’ll need to do.
 
Most importantly, the Journey Time Finder doesn’t function now it’s pre-populated. It’s really important that this works for ITS as this will be the one thing that ITS focus on. If the only way to9 make it work is to NOT pre-populate the ‘from’ field.
 
Is there anything you can do to beautify the pop-up window? It should really be in the same font as the website and a little more on brand – can you alter the colour/style at all? I fear LOCOG will throw this out as it is. (Baby with the bathwater…)
 
Template C2
This should have the UK map promo (now editable, see point two)
 
Note: The venue selector should only appear on page 2.0 – Locations of venues index page, not all pages using C2. And in fact this particular page is an index page so should use template C1
 
Template L1 (page 0.0, Getting to the Games) should have the Journey time finder promo and top tips.
 
Template C1 should have the top tips and journey time finder promos, and the UK map promo (now editable, see point two) but not the ‘Plan now’ promo. Currently the C1 pages have the ‘plan now’ promo twice but no others.
 
We’ve yet to send any pages to the staging server as I figured you’d need to do the above before we do that.
 
Any questions, drop me a line or call on the mobile below.
 
Cheers
Simon
Marking as solved. Included in #2446.
